revised_title: Preventing Dry-Rot in Ships with Salt Impregnation
tldr: James Mease proposes using salt to impregnate ship timbers and planks to prevent dry-rot, a method used by shipbuilders in Philadelphia. The salt penetrates and saturates the wood, inhibiting fermentation and the production of foul air. Some dampness is a minor inconvenience, but the author suggests possible remedies.
